results.title: Yoram Gross interview collection
results.brief_description:
Contains:
1.’Channel 9 News’ item: Blinky Bill
2. ‘TVTV’ program (Sept. 1993): Yoram Gross, Blinky Bill, Guy Cross, Robyn Moore, Robert Smit
3. ‘7.30 Report’ ABC: Keith Scott, Yoram Gross, Blinky BIll, Dot and the whale, Guy Cross
4. Dot & Kangaroo, Athol Henry, Animators, Dot goes to Hollywood
5. Guy Cross Film music
6. ‘Channel 7 News’ and ‘A Current Affair’ (June 1994): Blinky Bill versus Senator McGaurin
7. Ray Martin interviews Yoram Gross, Dot and Keeto
8. ‘Small Business Show’ Channel 9: Yoram Gross interview, Sandra Gross interview
9. News article on the Childrens Film Festival
10. Childrens Film Festival interview with Yoram Gross
11. Channel 9 News: Childrens Film Festival, Bob Hawke, Guy Cross
12 ‘Today Show’ Channel 9: Interview with Yoram Gross, Around the World with Dot
13. ‘Today Show’ Channel 9 (May 1985): Interview with Yoram Gross, Epic (poor image quality)
14. ‘C’mon Kids’: making Dot & Keeto with Athol Henry
15. ‘11am’ Channel 7: Dot & Keeto, Around the World with Dot, Dot Goes to Hollywood, Sarah
16. ‘Tutti’ SBS: Blinky Bill, Sarah, Bandstand
17. ‘Midday with Derryn Hinch’: Robyn Moore interview

results.title: Blinky Bill production featurette
results.brief_description: Documentary capturing the production process behind the creation of a Blinky Bill animated film. Includes storyboard and cel animation, sound recording, filming live action footage, creating models, music composition and sound recording.Yoram Gross, John Palmer (writer), Frank Hammond (cinematographer), Ray Nowland (art director), Guy Gross (composer) and other crew are also featured discussing their work.

results.title: Walter Spiel
results.creator_credit: James Fitzpatrick and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Man”.
A study of the 62 year old news vendor who sells American and foreign newspapers and magazines at his stand on a Los Angeles street corner. The camera establishes the relationship between “Willy” and his consumers as they come to his stand and look through their choices before purchase.

results.title: Reverend Leon Sullivan
results.creator_credit: Harold Mayer and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Man”.
Through his inspired leadership, the Rev. Sullivan has been able to redeem and transform thousands of school dropouts and potential criminals. Describes the Opportunities Industrialisation Centre which he organised in order to train people of the ghetto to become skilled workers. Narrated by Barry Sullivan.

results.title: Lyn McLain
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Man”.
Lyn McLain is the founder and director of the District of Columbia Youth Symphony Orchestra, one of the most extraordinary musical groups in the United States. It is made up of children, aged from eight to seventeen years, from all walks of life, who voluntarily give up their Saturdays to study music.

results.title: Jose Gonzales
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Man”.
The story of Jose Gonzales, a 12-year-old Puerto Rican newspaper delivery boy in Chicago, Illinois. We follow him through the trials of his first deliveries on an unfamiliar route. He quickly picks up the tricks of the trade and gets to know his many customers. His greatest moment is his return home waving his first pay cheque while his father acknowledges him as another man in the house.
